paper_abstract: A certificate of non-membership for a Boolean function f with respect to a class C, f is not an element of C, is a set S of input strings such that the values of f on strings from S are inconsistent with any function h is an element of C. We study certificates of non-membership with respect to several classes of read-once functions, generated by their bases. For the basis {&, boolean OR, (sic)}, we determine the optimal certificate size for every function outside the class and deduce that 6 strings always suffice. For the same basis augmented with a function x(1) ... x(s) V (x) over bar (1) ... (x) over bar (s), we show that there exist n-variable functions requiring Omega(n(s-1)) strings in a certificate as n -> infinity. For s = 2, we show that this bound is tight by constructing certificates of size O(n) for all functions outside the class.
paper_title: Certificates of Non-Membership for Classes of Read-Once Functions
